msItem.incipit: Omnibus dominicis per annum post primam et capitulum nisi in festis Exorzizo te creatura salis per deum + viuum
msItem.explicit: omnes habitantes in hoc habitaculo Per cristum dominum nostrum Amen
msItem.note: Manual, York Use, ‘Benedictio salis et aque’ ed. W. G. Henderson, Manuale et Processionale ad usum insignis Ecclesiae Eboracensis, Surtees Society 63 (1875), 5*–6*. Henderson describes our MS at pp. xviii–xix.

msItem.incipit: In primis inquirat sacerdos Signum sal + uatoris domini nostri ihesu cristi in frontem
msItem.explicit: nisi in oracione et ieiunio sequatur Euangelium In principio

msItem.rubric: Ordo ad sponsalia facienda sic incipit
msItem.incipit: statuantur uir et mulier Ecce conuenimus hic fratres coram deo et angelis eius
msItem.explicit: qui trinus est in numero et unus est in numine Amen
msItem.note: Ed. Manuale, 17*–26* (the vows and presentation of the ring in English, fols. 20, 20v–1).

msItem.incipit: In primis dicantur hij psalmi et preces sequentes Psalmus Ad te domine leuaui animam Psalmus Miserere mei
msItem.explicit: cum corporalibus et eisdem uentilet in oculis eius cum dicit In nomine patris
msItem.note: With associated blessings, the last, for the eyes, ascribed to ‘Magister WILLIELMUS DE MONTIBUS ecclesie lincolnij cancellarius’ (cf. Sharpe, no. 2129 [795–6]); ed. Manuale, 26*–32*.

msItem.incipit: In primis induat se sacerdos superpellicio cum stola et cum antiphona Ne reminiscaris domine Psalmus | [fol. 39] Domine ne in furore tuo
msItem.explicit: et salus et omnium peccatorum tuorum pius indultor Qui viuit et regnat cum deo patre
msItem.note: Ed. Manuale, 44*–8*. In this and the next six texts, a few later s. xv notes scattered in the margins.

msItem.incipit: Priusquam iniungatur infirmus incipiat sacerdos antiphonam Saluator mundi deinde dicatur Psalmus In te domine speraui
msItem.explicit: omnes gentes uenturum expectant ad iudicium qui cum deo patre [form ending] Amen

msItem.incipit: Cum uero anima in exitu dissolucione corporis Parce domine parce famulo tuo quem redimere dignatus es
msItem.explicit: animam serui tui de gehenne incendijs et ab omnibus angustijs Amen
msItem.note: ‘Commendatio animae in articulo mortis’, ed. Manuale, 52*–6*.

msItem.rubric: Sequatur commendacio animarum et dicatur in camera uel in aula
msItem.incipit: Subuenite sancti dei occurrite angeli domini suscipientes animam eius
msItem.explicit: hec porta domini iusti intrabunt in eam

msItem.rubric: Quo pacto incipiantur uigilie mortuorum sicut inferius patebit
msItem.explicit: tu uenia misericordissime pietatis absterge Per cristum dominum nostrum

msItem.rubric: Ad missam pro defunctis dicatur hoc modo
msItem.incipit: Officium Requiem eternam dona eis domine et lux
msItem.explicit: hijs sacrificijs expiata saluacionis tue perpetuo munere gratuletur Psalmus

msItem.incipit: Post missam accedat sacerdos ad caput defuncti | [fol. 94] Circumdederunt me gemitus mortis dolores inferni
msItem.explicit: per misericordiam dei in pace requiescant Amen

msItem.incipit: In purificacione beate marie cantata hora vja. fiat benedictio luminis Bene + dic domine ihesu criste hanc creaturam cere supplicantibus nobis
msItem.explicit: distribuantur cantore incipiente antiphonam Lumen ad te ut rn processionale continetur
msItem.note: ‘Benedictio cereorum in Purificatione’, ed. A. Jefferies Collins, Manuale ad usum percelebris Ecclesiae Sarisburiensis, HBS 91 (1960), 7–9.

msItem.rubric: Feria iiija. in capite ieiunij post vja
msItem.incipit: In primis fiat sermo ad populum si placuerit Deinde prosternant se
msItem.explicit: pugnaturi continencie muniamur auxilijs Per dominum tunc eat processio ut in processionale continetur

msItem.incipit: Dominica in Ramis palmarum post aspercionem aque benedicte legatur In diebus illis Venerunt filij israel in helym ubi erant
msItem.explicit: distribuantur palme et interim cantentur alleluia ut in processionale continetur
msItem.note: ‘Benedictio frondium in dominica palmarum’, ed. Collins, Manuale, 12–14.

msItem.incipit: Feria va. in cena domini in primis fiat reconsiliacio penitencium hoc modo ixa. cantata pergat Adest tempus o uenerande pontifex uotiuum afflictis
msItem.explicit: mandatum dedit mihi pater sic facio Surgite eamus hinc

msItem.rubric: Sabbato in uigilia pasche congregatis clericis in choro dictaque hora ixa
msItem.incipit: [fol. 119] Domine deus noster pater omnipotens lumen indeficiens conditor
msItem.explicit: [120v] tibi perpetua suauitate redolere. Per dominum.
msItem.finalRubric: Postea impleatur thuribulum quam zozinius papa [erased] constituit

msItem.incipit: Ego auctoritate dei patris et filii
msItem.explicit: descendat super te et maneat semper. Amen.

msItem.rubric: Quomodo homo uel mulier includi debeat
msItem.explicit: et sempiternis gaudeat institutis. Per dominum.

msItem.incipit: My dere sone in god þou hiest fast thi wai to godward there thou shalt see all
msItem.explicit: I beseche the of merci wiche deniest to no man merci
msItem.note: IPMEP 460A, ed. from this MS, William Maskell, Monumenta Ritualia Ecclesiae Anglicanae, 2nd edn., 3 vols. (Oxford, 1882), 3:413–19; and Manuale, 110*–12*.

supportDesc.extent:
Fols. iii + 126 + iii (numbered fols. iii bis, a mounted medieval leaf, and iv–v). 315 210
205 133
supportDesc.collation: 1–158 166. Catchwords toward the gutter; no signatures.

layoutDesc.layout: In long lines, 24 lines to the page. No prickings; bounded and ruled in pencil.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura quadrata. Punctuation by point, double point, and occasional punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Written in both red (liturgical instructions especially) and black, with music.

At major divisions, large champes (eight lines on fol. 1, others usually five lines) with demivinets (a full vinet on fol. 1) in violet, blue, gold leaf, orange, and green—all very faded through damp.

Within sections, major divisions marked by 2- and 3-line blue lombards on red flourishing (very occasional unflourished 3-line champes, e.g. fols. 61, 88v); smaller divisions alternate 1-line blue and red lombards on flourishing of the other colour.
Ornamental text ink strap capitals at the heads of musical portions, often with included human heads, more usually leaf forms.
Frequent 3-line extended blue paraphs on red flourishing.
See AT, no. 453 (45), dating s. xv2/4.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. At the front, three modern paper flyleaves; at the rear, one medieval vellum flyleaf pasted to paper and two modern paper flyleaves (iii bis, iv–v).

history.provenance: ‘Master coxe off Bugbroucke’ (fol. 121, upper margin, s. xv ex.), as well as a partially defaced English inscription ‘not in the ryght execusyon’ of hys ryghtwysnes’ (fol. 124v, lower margin).

‘Atany bannyng’ (s. xvi med.); the opening of a will with several small bequests ‘In dei nomine Amen & Ego Will’ pha Condo testu. in hunc modum . . .’; ‘Thomas Royland’ (twice), in one case in a sentence identifying him as ‘a knave’ (fol. iii bis).
history.acquisition: ‘Liber Collegij Sanctj Iohannis Baptistae Oxon’ ex dono Richardj Butler Doctoris Theologiae Archidiaconi Northampt procurante Reuerendo in Cristo Patre Iohanne Episcopo Roffensi’ (fol. 2, upper margin). Followed by a notation of the volume as a ‘Missale’, partly erased (a similar identification in the upper margin, fol. 1).

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002). For item 16, the folio range, the explicit, and the page reference to Collins, Manuale have all been corrected, and a final rubric added. Two further items have also been added between item 16 and item 19 [the latter formerly item 17]. We are grateful to Edward Jones for bringing the aforementioned omissions to our attention. A typographical error in the transcription of item 19 [formerly item 17] has also been corrected.
